meanings.definition: A person or thing situated away or detached from the main body or system.
meanings.sent1: The cabin in the woods was an outlier, far from the bustling city.
meanings.sent2: The island was an outlier in the vast ocean, isolated from the mainland.
meanings.sent3: The lone cloud in a clear sky was the outlier, making the scene look incomplete.
meanings.sent4: The black sheep of the family was the outlier, always standing out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The unique flower in the garden was the outlier, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A statistical observation that is markedly different in value from the others in a dataset.
meanings.sent1: In the data set, the unusually high value was considered an outlier.
meanings.sent2: The outlier in the graph skewed the overall trend of the data points.
meanings.sent3: The outlier data point was like a rebel in the group, refusing to follow the trend.
meanings.sent4: The outlier stood out like a sore thumb, drawing attention to its uniqueness.
meanings.sent5: Identifying outliers in the data can help in understanding the overall pattern better.
